Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Characters

September 28, 2022
thugit
A must have. I’ll be using this guy until I quit playing. Charges in, busts heads, and then vanishes. Playing him with the new Utility Belt makes him 5/5 stars. Perplex and Empower to help his teammates, Outwit and excellent stats to help himself, and all the keywords you’d want in a Bruce Wayne Batman. If you’re a Batman fan, this one is a must have.
September 27, 2022
No-Name
I’d like to echo pokolo’s confusion in how this is less expensive than the Common. Is Rally that valuable? Or is this just another case of higher rarity equals more power for less points?
September 26, 2022
Oathful
This guy is probably one of the best Batman figures we've had in the last couple years. Simple and effective, he combines being an excellent secondary attacker with great safety and some of the best support powers for a close range piece, all at a bargain price. Going off of what Pokolo said, super rares feel very undercosted in today's game IMO. I've been going back through older sets as part of a project of mine, and while yes super rares have always a lower point value for what they provide, it was never as big a deficit as it is now in modern sets. Now when sets release I hardly have a reason to look at the commons/uncommons/rares, save for some good support pieces and the primes. I miss being able to play my (now silver age) Teen Titans and not having to worry about being completely blown out of the water by figures that have twice the abilities for half the cost of my figures. I feel like this topic deserves its own thread, but I couldn't help but leave my take on figures like this here.

Full dial perplex/outwit… Can charge in then disappear/retreat to safety via hindering… amazing for only 60 points… team him up with someone with smoke cloud (especially free smoke cloud) so he always has somewhere to hide. Also if you compare this dial with the 75 point common… how is this 15 points less?
